password.Description: Password for UpCloud API user. Can also be configured using the `UPCLOUD_PASSWORD` environment variable.

retry_wait_max_sec.Description: Maximum time to wait between retries

retry_wait_min_sec.Description: Minimum time to wait between retries

username.Description: UpCloud username with API access. Can also be configured using the `UPCLOUD_USERNAME` environment variable.

firewall_rule.Description:
A single firewall rule.
				If used, IP address and port ranges must have both start and end values specified. These can be the same value if only one IP address or port number is specified.
				Source and destination port numbers can only be set if the protocol is TCP or UDP.
				The ICMP type may only be set if the protocol is ICMP.
				Typical firewall rule should have "action", "direction", "protocol", "family" and at least one destination/source-address/port range.
				The default rule can be created by providing only "action" and "direction" attributes. Default rule should be defined last.

action.Description: Action to take if the rule conditions are met

comment.Description: Freeform comment string for the rule

destination_address_end.Description: The destination address range ends from this address

destination_address_start.Description: The destination address range starts from this address

destination_port_end.Description: The destination port range ends from this port number

destination_port_start.Description: The destination port range starts from this port number

direction.Description: The direction of network traffic this rule will be applied to

family.Description: The address family of new firewall rule

protocol.Description: The protocol this rule will be applied to

source_address_end.Description: The source address range ends from this address

source_address_start.Description: The source address range starts from this address

source_port_end.Description: The source port range ends from this port number

source_port_start.Description: The source port range starts from this port number

server_id.Description: The unique id of the server to be protected the firewall rules

access.Description: Is address for utility or public network

family.Description: The address family of new IP address

mac_address.Description: MAC address of server interface to assign address to

zone.Description: Zone of address, required when assigning a detached floating IP address

name.Description: Cluster name. Needs to be unique within the account.

network.Description: Network ID for the cluster to run in.

network_cidr.Description: Network CIDR for the given network. Computed automatically.

node_group.Description: Node groups for workloads. Currently not available in state, although created.

count.Description: Amount of nodes to provision in the node group.

kubelet_args.Description: Additional arguments for kubelet for the nodes in this group. WARNING - those arguments will be passed directly to kubelet CLI on each worker node without any validation. Passing invalid arguments can break your whole cluster. Be extra careful when adding kubelet args.

labels.Description: Key-value pairs to classify the node group.

name.Description: The name of the node group. Needs to be unique within a cluster.

plan.Description: The pricing plan used for the node group. Valid values available via `upcloud_kubernetes_plan` datasource field `description`.

ssh_keys.Description: You can optionally select SSH keys to be added as authorized keys to the nodes in this node group. This allows you to connect to the nodes via SSH once they are running.

taint.Description: Taints for the nodes in this group.

zone.Description: Zone in which the Kubernetes cluster will be hosted, e.g. `de-fra1`.

backends.Description: Backends are groups of customer servers whose traffic should be balanced.

configured_status.Description: The service configured status indicates the service's current intended status. Managed by the customer.

dns_name.Description: DNS name of the load balancer

frontends.Description: Frontends receive the traffic before dispatching it to the backends.

name.Description: The name of the service must be unique within customer account.

network.Description: Private network UUID where traffic will be routed. Must reside in load balancer zone.

operational_state.Description: The service operational state indicates the service's current operational, effective state. Managed by the system.

plan.Description: Plan which the service will have

resolvers.Description: Domain Name Resolvers must be configured in case of customer uses dynamic type members

zone.Description: Zone in which the service will be hosted, e.g. `fi-hel1`.

loadbalancer.Description: ID of the load balancer to which the backend is connected.

members.Description: Backend members receive traffic dispatched from the frontends

name.Description: The name of the backend must be unique within the load balancer service.

properties.Description: Backend properties. Properties can set back to defaults by defining empty `properties {}` block.

health_check_expected_status.Description: Expected HTTP status code returned by the customer application to mark server as healthy. Ignored for tcp type.

health_check_fall.Description: Sets how many failed health checks are allowed until the backend member is taken off from the rotation.

health_check_rise.Description: Sets how many passing checks there must be before returning the backend member to the rotation.

health_check_url.Description: Target path for health check HTTP GET requests. Ignored for tcp type.

outbound_proxy_protocol.Description: Enable outbound proxy protocol by setting the desired version. Empty string disables proxy protocol.

sticky_session_cookie_name.Description: Sets sticky session cookie name. Empty string disables sticky session.

timeout_tunnel.Description: Maximum inactivity time on the client and server side for tunnels in seconds.

resolver_name.Description: Domain Name Resolver used with dynamic type members.

backend.Description: ID of the load balancer backend to which the member is connected.

enabled.Description: Indicates if the member is enabled. Disabled members are excluded from load balancing.

ip.Description: Optional fallback IP address in case of failure on DNS resolving.

max_sessions.Description: Maximum number of sessions before queueing.

name.Description: The name of the member must be unique within the load balancer backend service.

port.Description: Server port. Port is optional and can be specified in DNS SRV record.

weight.Description:
Used to adjust the server's weight relative to other servers. 
				All servers will receive a load proportional to their weight relative to the sum of all weights, so the higher the weight, the higher the load. 
				A value of 0 means the server will not participate in load balancing but will still accept persistent connections.

name.Description: The name of the bundle must be unique within customer account.

not_after.Description: The time after which a certificate is no longer valid.

not_before.Description: The time on which a certificate becomes valid.

operational_state.Description: The service operational state indicates the service's current operational, effective state. Managed by the system.

default_backend_name.Description: The name of the default backend where traffic will be routed. Note, default backend can be overwritten in frontend rules.

loadbalancer.Description: ID of the load balancer to which the frontend is connected.

mode.Description: When load balancer operating in `tcp` mode it acts as a layer 4 proxy. In `http` mode it acts as a layer 7 proxy.

name.Description: The name of the frontend must be unique within the load balancer service.

properties.Description: Frontend properties. Properties can set back to defaults by defining empty `properties {}` block.

inbound_proxy_protocol.Description: Enable or disable inbound proxy protocol support.

http_redirect.Description: Redirects HTTP requests to specified location or URL schema.

http_return.Description: Returns HTTP response with specified HTTP status.

set_forwarded_headers.Description: Adds 'X-Forwarded-For / -Proto / -Port' headers in your forwarded requests

backend_name.Description: The name of the backend where traffic will be routed.

frontend.Description: ID of the load balancer frontend to which the rule is connected.

matchers.Description: Set of rule matchers. if rule doesn't have matchers, then action applies to all incoming requests.

body_size.Description: Matches by HTTP request body size.

body_size_range.Description: Matches by range of HTTP request body sizes

cookie.Description: Matches by HTTP cookie value. Cookie name must be provided.

method.Description: Match method (`exact`, `substring`, `regexp`, `starts`, `ends`, `domain`, `ip`, `exists`). Matcher with `exists` and `ip` methods must be used without `value` and `ignore_case` fields.

name.Description: Name of the argument.

header.Description: Matches by HTTP header value. Header name must be provided.

method.Description: Match method (`exact`, `substring`, `regexp`, `starts`, `ends`, `domain`, `ip`, `exists`). Matcher with `exists` and `ip` methods must be used without `value` and `ignore_case` fields.

name.Description: Name of the argument.

host.Description: Matches by hostname. Header extracted from HTTP Headers or from TLS certificate in case of secured connection.

num_members_up.Description: Matches by number of healthy backend members.

backend_name.Description: The name of the `backend` which members will be monitored.

method.Description: Match method (`exact`, `substring`, `regexp`, `starts`, `ends`, `domain`, `ip`, `exists`). Matcher with `exists` and `ip` methods must be used without `value` and `ignore_case` fields.

value.Description: IP address. CIDR masks are supported, e.g. `192.168.0.0/24`.

src_port_range.Description: Matches by range of source port numbers

url.Description: Matches by URL without schema, e.g. `example.com/dashboard`.

method.Description: Match method (`exact`, `substring`, `regexp`, `starts`, `ends`, `domain`, `ip`, `exists`). Matcher with `exists` and `ip` methods must be used without `value` and `ignore_case` fields.

url_param.Description: Matches by URL query parameter value. Query parameter name must be provided

method.Description: Match method (`exact`, `substring`, `regexp`, `starts`, `ends`, `domain`, `ip`, `exists`). Matcher with `exists` and `ip` methods must be used without `value` and `ignore_case` fields.

name.Description: Name of the argument.

method.Description: Match method (`exact`, `substring`, `regexp`, `starts`, `ends`, `domain`, `ip`, `exists`). Matcher with `exists` and `ip` methods must be used without `value` and `ignore_case` fields.

name.Description: The name of the frontend rule must be unique within the load balancer service.

priority.Description: Rule with the higher priority goes first. Rules with the same priority processed in alphabetical order.

frontend.Description: ID of the load balancer frontend to which the TLS config is connected.

name.Description: The name of the TLS config must be unique within service frontend.

certificate.Description: Certificate within base64 string must be in PEM format.

intermediates.Description: Intermediate certificates within base64 string must be in PEM format.

name.Description: The name of the bundle must be unique within customer account.

not_after.Description: The time after which a certificate is no longer valid.

not_before.Description: The time on which a certificate becomes valid.

operational_state.Description: The service operational state indicates the service's current operational, effective state. Managed by the system.

private_key.Description: Private key within base64 string must be in PEM format.

cache_invalid.Description: Time in seconds to cache invalid results.

cache_valid.Description: Time in seconds to cache valid results.

loadbalancer.Description: ID of the load balancer to which the resolver is connected.

name.Description: The name of the resolver must be unique within the service.

nameservers.Description:
List of nameserver IP addresses. Nameserver can reside in public internet or in customer private network. 
				Port is optional, if missing then default 53 will be used.

timeout.Description: Timeout for the query in seconds.

timeout_retry.Description: Timeout for the query retries in seconds.

backend.Description: ID of the load balancer backend to which the member is connected.

enabled.Description: Indicates if the member is enabled. Disabled members are excluded from load balancing.

ip.Description: Server IP address in the customer private network.

max_sessions.Description: Maximum number of sessions before queueing.

name.Description: The name of the member must be unique within the load balancer backend service.

weight.Description:
Used to adjust the server's weight relative to other servers. 
				All servers will receive a load proportional to their weight relative to the sum of all weights, so the higher the weight, the higher the load. 
				A value of 0 means the server will not participate in load balancing but will still accept persistent connections.

character_set.Description: Default character set for the database (LC_CTYPE)

name.Description: Name of the logical database

service.Description: Service's UUID for which this user belongs to

maintenance_window_dow.Description: Maintenance window day of week. Lower case weekday name (monday, tuesday, ...)

maintenance_window_time.Description: Maintenance window UTC time in hh:mm:ss format

name.Description: Name of the service. The name is used as a prefix for the logical hostname. Must be unique within an account

node_states.Description: Information about nodes providing the managed service

name.Description: Name plus a node iteration

plan.Description: Service plan to use. This determines how much resources the instance will have

powered.Description: The administrative power state of the service

admin_password.Description: Custom password for admin user. Defaults to random string. This must be set only when a new service is being created.

admin_username.Description: Custom username for admin user. This must be set only when a new service is being created.

backup_hour.Description: The hour of day (in UTC) when backup for the service is started. New backup is only started if previous backup has already completed.

backup_minute.Description: The minute of an hour when backup for the service is started. New backup is only started if previous backup has already completed.

binlog_retention_period.Description: The minimum amount of time in seconds to keep binlog entries before deletion. This may be extended for services that require binlog entries for longer than the default for example if using the MySQL Debezium Kafka connector.

connect_timeout.Description: The number of seconds that the mysqld server waits for a connect packet before responding with Bad handshake

default_time_zone.Description: Default server time zone as an offset from UTC (from -12:00 to +12:00), a time zone name, or `SYSTEM` to use the MySQL server default.

group_concat_max_len.Description: The maximum permitted result length in bytes for the `GROUP_CONCAT()` function.

information_schema_stats_expiry.Description: The time, in seconds, before cached statistics expire.

innodb_ft_min_token_size.Description: Minimum length of words that are stored in an InnoDB `FULLTEXT` index.

innodb_ft_server_stopword_table.Description: This option is used to specify your own InnoDB `FULLTEXT` index stopword list for all InnoDB tables.

innodb_lock_wait_timeout.Description: The length of time in seconds an InnoDB transaction waits for a row lock before giving up.

innodb_log_buffer_size.Description: The size in bytes of the buffer that InnoDB uses to write to the log files on disk.

innodb_online_alter_log_max_size.Description: The upper limit in bytes on the size of the temporary log files used during online DDL operations for InnoDB tables.

innodb_print_all_deadlocks.Description: When enabled, information about all deadlocks in InnoDB user transactions is recorded in the error log. Disabled by default.

innodb_rollback_on_timeout.Description: When enabled a transaction timeout causes InnoDB to abort and roll back the entire transaction.

interactive_timeout.Description: The number of seconds the server waits for activity on an interactive connection before closing it.

internal_tmp_mem_storage_engine.Description: The storage engine for in-memory internal temporary tables.

long_query_time.Description: The `slow_query_logs` work as SQL statements that take more than `long_query_time` seconds to execute. Default is `10s`

max_allowed_packet.Description: Size of the largest message in bytes that can be received by the server. Default is `67108864` (64M)

max_heap_table_size.Description: Limits the size of internal in-memory tables. Also set `tmp_table_size`. Default is `16777216` (16M)

dbname.Description: Database name for bootstrapping the initial connection

host.Description: Hostname or IP address of the server where to migrate data from

ignore_dbs.Description: Comma-separated list of databases, which should be ignored during migration (supported by MySQL only at the moment)

password.Description: Password for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

port.Description: Port number of the server where to migrate data from

ssl.Description: The server where to migrate data from is secured with SSL

username.Description: User name for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

net_read_timeout.Description: The number of seconds to wait for more data from a connection before aborting the read.

net_write_timeout.Description: The number of seconds to wait for a block to be written to a connection before aborting the write.

public_access.Description: Public access allows connections to your Managed Database services via the public internet.

slow_query_log.Description: Slow query log enables capturing of slow queries. Setting `slow_query_log` to false also truncates the `mysql.slow_log` table. Default is off

sort_buffer_size.Description: Sort buffer size in bytes for `ORDER BY` optimization. Default is `262144` (256K)

sql_mode.Description:
Global SQL mode. Set to empty to use MySQL server defaults. 
			When creating a new service and not setting this field default SQL mode (strict, SQL standard compliant) will be assigned.

sql_require_primary_key.Description:
Require primary key to be defined for new tables or old tables modified with ALTER TABLE and fail if missing. 
			It is recommended to always have primary keys because various functionality may break if any large table is missing them.

tmp_table_size.Description: Limits the size of internal in-memory tables. Also set `max_heap_table_size`. Default is `16777216` (16M)

wait_timeout.Description: The number of seconds the server waits for activity on a noninteractive connection before closing it.

service_password.Description: Primary username's password to the service instance

service_username.Description: Primary username to the service instance

title.Description: Title of a managed database instance

maintenance_window_dow.Description: Maintenance window day of week. Lower case weekday name (monday, tuesday, ...)

maintenance_window_time.Description: Maintenance window UTC time in hh:mm:ss format

name.Description: Name of the service. The name is used as a prefix for the logical hostname. Must be unique within an account

node_states.Description: Information about nodes providing the managed service

name.Description: Name plus a node iteration

plan.Description: Service plan to use. This determines how much resources the instance will have

powered.Description: The administrative power state of the service

admin_password.Description: Custom password for admin user. Defaults to random string. This must be set only when a new service is being created.

admin_username.Description: Custom username for admin user. This must be set only when a new service is being created.

autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor.Description: Specifies a fraction of the table size to add to `autovacuum_analyze_threshold` when deciding whether to trigger an `ANALYZE`. The default is `0.2` (20% of table size)

autovacuum_analyze_threshold.Description: Specifies the minimum number of inserted, updated or deleted tuples needed to trigger an ANALYZE in any one table. The default is `50` tuples.

autovacuum_freeze_max_age.Description:
Specifies the maximum age (in transactions) that a table's `pg_class.relfrozenxid` field can attain before a `VACUUM` operation is forced to prevent transaction ID wraparound within the table. 
				Note that the system will launch autovacuum processes to prevent wraparound even when autovacuum is otherwise disabled. 
				This parameter will cause the server to be restarted.

autovacuum_max_workers.Description: Specifies the maximum number of autovacuum processes (other than the autovacuum launcher) that may be running at any one time. The default is `3`. This parameter can only be set at server start.

autovacuum_naptime.Description: Specifies the minimum delay between autovacuum runs on any given database. The delay is measured in seconds, and the default is `1` minute

autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay.Description: Specifies the cost delay value that will be used in automatic VACUUM operations. If `-1` is specified, the regular `vacuum_cost_delay` value will be used. The default value is `20` milliseconds

autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit.Description: Specifies the cost limit value that will be used in automatic `VACUUM` operations. If `-1` is specified (which is the default), the regular `vacuum_cost_limit` value will be used.

autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor.Description: Specifies a fraction of the table size to add to autovacuum_vacuum_threshold when deciding whether to trigger a `VACUUM`. The default is `0.2` (20% of table size)

autovacuum_vacuum_threshold.Description: Specifies the minimum number of updated or deleted tuples needed to trigger a `VACUUM` in any one table. The default is `50` tuples

backup_hour.Description: The hour of day (in UTC) when backup for the service is started. New backup is only started if previous backup has already completed.

backup_minute.Description: The minute of an hour when backup for the service is started. New backup is only started if previous backup has already completed.

bgwriter_delay.Description: Specifies the delay between activity rounds for the background writer in milliseconds. Default is `200`.

bgwriter_flush_after.Description: Whenever more than `bgwriter_flush_after` bytes have been written by the background writer, attempt to force the OS to issue these writes to the underlying storage. Specified in kilobytes, default is `512`. Setting of `0` disables forced writeback.

bgwriter_lru_maxpages.Description: In each round, no more than this many buffers will be written by the background writer. Setting this to zero disables background writing. Default is `100`.

bgwriter_lru_multiplier.Description: The average recent need for new buffers is multiplied by `bgwriter_lru_multiplier` to arrive at an estimate of the number that will be needed during the next round (up to `bgwriter_lru_maxpages`). `1.0` represents a "just in time" policy of writing exactly the number of buffers predicted to be needed. Larger values provide some cushion against spikes in demand, while smaller values intentionally leave writes to be done by server processes. The default is `2.0`.

deadlock_timeout.Description: This is the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait on a lock before checking to see if there is a deadlock condition.

default_toast_compression.Description: Controls the amount of detail written in the server log for each message that is logged.

idle_in_transaction_session_timeout.Description: Time out sessions with open transactions after this number of milliseconds.

jit.Description: Controls system-wide use of Just-in-Time Compilation (JIT).

log_autovacuum_min_duration.Description: Causes each action executed by autovacuum to be logged if it ran for at least the specified number of milliseconds. Setting this to `0` logs all autovacuum actions. The default `-1` disables logging autovacuum actions.

log_error_verbosity.Description: Controls the amount of detail written in the server log for each message that is logged.

log_line_prefix.Description: Choose from one of the available log-formats. These can support popular log analyzers like pgbadger, pganalyze etc.

log_min_duration_statement.Description: Log statements that take more than this number of milliseconds to run, `-1` disables

max_files_per_process.Description: PostgreSQL maximum number of files that can be open per process.

max_logical_replication_workers.Description: PostgreSQL maximum logical replication workers (taken from the pool of `max_parallel_workers`).

max_parallel_workers.Description: Sets the maximum number of workers that the system can support for parallel queries.

max_parallel_workers_per_gather.Description: Sets the maximum number of workers that can be started by a single Gather or Gather Merge node.

max_pred_locks_per_transaction.Description: PostgreSQL maximum predicate locks per transaction.

max_slot_wal_keep_size.Description: PostgreSQL maximum WAL size (MB) reserved for replication slots. Default is `-1` (unlimited). `wal_keep_size` minimum WAL size setting takes precedence over this.

max_stack_depth.Description: Maximum depth of the stack in bytes.

max_standby_archive_delay.Description: Max standby archive delay in milliseconds.

max_standby_streaming_delay.Description: Max standby streaming delay in milliseconds.

max_worker_processes.Description: Sets the maximum number of background processes that the system can support.

dbname.Description: Database name for bootstrapping the initial connection

host.Description: Hostname or IP address of the server where to migrate data from

ignore_dbs.Description: Comma-separated list of databases, which should be ignored during migration (supported by MySQL only at the moment)

password.Description: Password for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

port.Description: Port number of the server where to migrate data from

ssl.Description: The server where to migrate data from is secured with SSL

username.Description: User name for authentication with the server where to migrate data from

pg_partman_bgw_interval.Description: Sets the time interval to run pg_partman's scheduled tasks.

pg_partman_bgw_role.Description: Controls which role to use for pg_partman's scheduled background tasks.

pg_read_replica.Description: Should the service which is being forked be a read replica (deprecated, use read_replica service integration instead).

pg_service_to_fork_from.Description: Name of the PG Service from which to fork (deprecated, use service_to_fork_from). This has effect only when a new service is being created.

pg_stat_statements_track.Description:
Controls which statements are counted. 
			Specify top to track top-level statements (those issued directly by clients), all to also track nested statements (such as statements invoked within functions), 
			or none to disable statement statistics collection.The default value is `top`.

autodb_idle_timeout.Description: If the automatically created database pools have been unused this many seconds, they are freed. If 0 then timeout is disabled. [seconds]

autodb_max_db_connections.Description: Do not allow more than this many server connections per database (regardless of user). Setting it to 0 means unlimited.

autodb_pool_size.Description: If non-zero then create automatically a pool of that size per user when a pool doesn't exist.

ignore_startup_parameters.Description: List of parameters to ignore when given in startup packet

min_pool_size.Description: Add more server connections to pool if below this number. Improves behavior when usual load comes suddenly back after period of total inactivity. The value is effectively capped at the pool size.

server_idle_timeout.Description: If a server connection has been idle more than this many seconds it will be dropped. If 0 then timeout is disabled. [seconds]

server_lifetime.Description: The pooler will close an unused server connection that has been connected longer than this. [seconds]

server_reset_query_always.Description: Run server_reset_query (`DISCARD ALL`) in all pooling modes

max_failover_replication_time_lag.Description: Number of seconds of master unavailability before triggering database failover to standby

public_access.Description: Public access allows connections to your Managed Database services via the public internet.

shared_buffers_percentage.Description:
Percentage of total RAM that the database server uses for shared memory buffers. 
				Valid range is 20-60 (float), which corresponds to 20% - 60%. This setting adjusts the `shared_buffers` configuration value.

synchronous_replication.Description: Synchronous replication type. Note that the service plan also needs to support synchronous replication.

temp_file_limit.Description: PostgreSQL temporary file limit in KiB, -1 for unlimited

max_background_workers.Description:
The number of background workers for timescaledb operations. 
						You should configure this setting to the sum of your number of databases and the total number of concurrent background workers you want running at any given point in time.

track_activity_query_size.Description: Specifies the number of bytes reserved to track the currently executing command for each active session.

track_functions.Description: Enables tracking of function call counts and time used.

track_io_timing.Description:
Enables timing of database I/O calls. 
			This parameter is off by default, because it will repeatedly query the operating system for the current time, which may cause significant overhead on some platforms.

variant.Description: Variant of the PostgreSQL service, may affect the features that are exposed by default

wal_sender_timeout.Description: Terminate replication connections that are inactive for longer than this amount of time, in milliseconds. Setting this value to `0` disables the timeout.

wal_writer_delay.Description: WAL flush interval in milliseconds. Note that setting this value to lower than the default `200`ms may negatively impact performance

work_mem.Description:
Sets the maximum amount of memory to be used by a query operation (such as a sort or hash table) before writing to temporary disk files, 
			in MB. Default is 1MB + 0.075% of total RAM (up to 32MB).

service_password.Description: Primary username's password to the service instance

service_username.Description: Primary username to the service instance

title.Description: Title of a managed database instance

password.Description: Password for the database user. Defaults to a random value

service.Description: Service's UUID for which this user belongs to

type.Description: Type of the user. Only normal type users can be created

ip_network.Description: A list of IP subnets within the network

address.Description: The CIDR range of the subnet

dhcp_default_route.Description: Is the gateway the DHCP default route?

dhcp_dns.Description: The DNS servers given by DHCP

name.Description: A valid name for the network

zone.Description: The zone the network is in

access_key.Description:
The access key used to identify user.
				Can be set to an empty string, which will tell the provider to get the access key from environment variable.
				The environment variable should be "UPCLOUD_OBJECT_STORAGE_ACCESS_KEY_{name}".
				{name} is the name given to object storage instance (so not the resource label), it should be all uppercased
				and all dashes (-) should be replaced with underscores (_). For example, object storage named "my-files" would
				use environment variable named "UPCLOUD_OBJECT_STORAGE_ACCESS_KEY_MY_FILES".

name.Description: The name of the bucket

description.Description: The description of the object storage instance to be created

name.Description: The name of the object storage instance to be created

secret_key.Description:
The secret key used to authenticate user.
				Can be set to an empty string, which will tell the provider to get the secret key from environment variable.
				The environment variable should be "UPCLOUD_OBJECT_STORAGE_SECRET_KEY_{name}".
				{name} is the name given to object storage instance (so not the resource label), it should be all uppercased
				and all dashes (-) should be replaced with underscores (_). For example, object storage named "my-files" would
				use environment variable named "UPCLOUD_OBJECT_STORAGE_SECRET_KEY_MY_FILES".

size.Description: The size of the object storage instance in gigabytes

zone.Description: The zone in which the object storage instance will be created

attached_networks.Description: A collection of UUID representing networks attached to this router

name.Description: Name of the router

cpu.Description: The number of CPU for the server

firewall.Description: Are firewall rules active for the server

host.Description: Use this to start the VM on a specific host. Refers to value from host -attribute. Only available for private cloud hosts

labels.Description: Labels contain key-value pairs to classify the server

login.Description: Configure access credentials to the server

create_password.Description: Indicates a password should be create to allow access

keys.Description: A list of ssh keys to access the server

password_delivery.Description: The delivery method for the server's root password (one of `none`, `email` or `sms`)

user.Description: Username to be create to access the server

mem.Description: The size of memory for the server (in megabytes)

metadata.Description: Is the metadata service active for the server

network_interface.Description: One or more blocks describing the network interfaces of the server.

bootable.Description: `true` if this interface should be used for network booting.

ip_address_family.Description: The IP address type of this interface (one of `IPv4` or `IPv6`).

ip_address_floating.Description: `true` is a floating IP address is attached.

network.Description: The unique ID of a network to attach this network to.

source_ip_filtering.Description: `true` if source IP should be filtered.

type.Description: Network interface type. For private network interfaces, a network must be specified with an existing network id.

plan.Description: The pricing plan used for the server

simple_backup.Description:
Simple backup schedule configuration  
				The idea behind simple backups is to provide a simplified way of backing up *all* of the storages attached to a given server. 
				This means you cannot have simple backup set for a server, and then some individual backup_rules on the storages attached to said server. 
				Such configuration will throw an error during execution. This also apply to backup_rules set for server templates.  
				Also, due to how UpCloud API works with simple backups and how Terraform orders the update operations, 
				it is advised to never switch between simple_backup on the server and individual storages backup_rules in one apply.
				If you want to switch from using server simple backup to per-storage defined backup rules, 
				please first remove simple_backup block from a server, run 'terraform apply', 
				then add backup_rule to desired storages and run 'terraform apply' again.

plan.Description: Simple backup plan. Accepted values: dailies, weeklies, monthlies.

time.Description: Time of the day at which backup will be taken. Should be provided in a hhmm format (e.g. 2230).

storage_devices.Description: A list of storage devices associated with the server

address.Description: The device address the storage will be attached to. Specify only the bus name (ide/scsi/virtio) to auto-select next available address from that bus.

type.Description: The device type the storage will be attached as

template.Description: Block describing the preconfigured operating system

address.Description: The device address the storage will be attached to. Specify only the bus name (ide/scsi/virtio) to auto-select next available address from that bus.

backup_rule.Description:
The criteria to backup the storage  
		Please keep in mind that it's not possible to have a server with backup_rule attached to a server with simple_backup specified.
		Such configurations will throw errors during execution.  
		Also, due to how UpCloud API works with simple backups and how Terraform orders the update operations, 
		it is advised to never switch between simple_backup on the server and individual storages backup_rules in one apply.
		If you want to switch from using server simple backup to per-storage defined backup rules, 
		please first remove simple_backup block from a server, run 'terraform apply', 
		then add 'backup_rule' to desired storages and run 'terraform apply' again.

interval.Description: The weekday when the backup is created

retention.Description: The number of days before a backup is automatically deleted

time.Description: The time of day when the backup is created

delete_autoresize_backup.Description: If set to true, the backup taken before the partition and filesystem resize attempt will be deleted immediately after success.

filesystem_autoresize.Description:
If set to true, provider will attempt to resize partition and filesystem when the size of template storage changes.
							Please note that before the resize attempt is made, backup of the storage will be taken. If the resize attempt fails, the backup will be used
							to restore the storage and then deleted. If the resize attempt succeeds, backup will be kept (unless delete_autoresize_backup option is set to true).
							Taking and keeping backups incure costs.

id.Description: The unique identifier for the storage

size.Description: The size of the storage in gigabytes

storage.Description: A valid storage UUID or template name

user_data.Description: Defines URL for a server setup script, or the script body itself

zone.Description: The zone in which the server will be hosted

backup_rule.Description:
The criteria to backup the storage  
		Please keep in mind that it's not possible to have a server with backup_rule attached to a server with simple_backup specified.
		Such configurations will throw errors during execution.  
		Also, due to how UpCloud API works with simple backups and how Terraform orders the update operations, 
		it is advised to never switch between simple_backup on the server and individual storages backup_rules in one apply.
		If you want to switch from using server simple backup to per-storage defined backup rules, 
		please first remove simple_backup block from a server, run 'terraform apply', 
		then add 'backup_rule' to desired storages and run 'terraform apply' again.

interval.Description: The weekday when the backup is created

retention.Description: The number of days before a backup is automatically deleted

time.Description: The time of day when the backup is created

clone.Description: Block defining another storage/template to clone to storage

id.Description: The unique identifier of the storage/template to clone

delete_autoresize_backup.Description: If set to true, the backup taken before the partition and filesystem resize attempt will be deleted immediately after success.

filesystem_autoresize.Description:
If set to true, provider will attempt to resize partition and filesystem when the size of the storage changes.
				Please note that before the resize attempt is made, backup of the storage will be taken. If the resize attempt fails, the backup will be used
				to restore the storage and then deleted. If the resize attempt succeeds, backup will be kept (unless delete_autoresize_backup option is set to true).
				Taking and keeping backups incure costs.

import.Description: Block defining external data to import to storage

sha256sum.Description: sha256 sum of the imported data

source.Description: The mode of the import task. One of `http_import` or `direct_upload`.

source_hash.Description: For `direct_upload`; an optional hash of the file to upload.

source_location.Description: The location of the file to import. For `http_import` an accessible URL for `direct_upload` a local file.

size.Description: The size of the storage in gigabytes

zone.Description: The zone in which the storage will be created

description.Description: Free form text representing the meaning of the tag

name.Description: The value representing the tag

servers.Description: A collection of servers that have been assigned the tag

description.Description: Free form text describing the host

host_id.Description: The unique id of the host

zone.Description: The zone the host is in

access.Description: Is address for utility or public network

floating.Description: Does the IP Address represents a floating IP Address

mac.Description: MAC address of server interface to assign address to

part_of_plan.Description: Is the address a part of a plan

server.Description: The unique identifier for a server

zone.Description: Zone of address, required when assigning a detached floating IP address

cluster_ca_certificate.Description: TLS authentication root certificate bundle, encoded (PEM).

host.Description: Hostname of the cluster API. Defined as URI.

kubeconfig.Description: Kubernetes config file contents for the cluster.

name.Description: Cluster name. Needs to be unique within the account.

description.Description: The description of a pricing plan. e.g. `K8S-2xCPU-4GB`.

name.Description: The name used to identify a pricing plan, e.g. `large`.

filter_name.Description: If specified, results will be filtered to match name using a regular expression

ip_network.Description: A list of IP subnets within the network

address.Description: The CIDR range of the subnet

dhcp_default_route.Description: Is the gateway the DHCP default route?

dhcp_dns.Description: The DNS servers given by DHCP

name.Description: A valid name for the network

title.Description: The short description of the server

zone.Description: The zone the network is in
If specified, this data source will return only networks from this zone

most_recent.Description: If more than one result is returned, use the most recent storage. This is only useful with private storages. Public storages might give unpredictable results.

name.Description: Exact name of the storage (same as title)

name_regex.Description: Use regular expression to match storage name

size.Description: Size of the storage in gigabytes

type.Description: Storage type (normal, backup, cdrom, template). Use 'favorite' as type to filter storages on the list of favorites.

zone.Description: The zone in which the storage resides

description.Description: Free form text representing the meaning of the tag

name.Description: The value representing the tag

servers.Description: A collection of servers that have been assigned the tag

name.Description: Unique lablel for the zone

public.Description: Indicates whether the zone is public
